FacilityName: ProGas Company, Inc. - Office and Bottle Plant
FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
CERTIFICATION STATEMENT

The undersigned certifies that, to the best of my knowledge, information and belief, formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.

Date:  March 24, 1999

RMP prepared by :  Kane Environmental Engineering, Inc.

Verified by:  Joe Saldivar, Risk Manager, Indpendent Propane Company

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

It is the policy of Independent Propane Company to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with applicable state and federal laws.  This facility is inspected regularly by the Fire Marshall.

In the event of an emergency involving anhydrous ammonia, it is our policy to notify the Waynesboro Fire Department and the Burke County Emergency Management Agency (EMA) for emergency response assistance.  Prior arrangements have been made with these agencies for emergency response assistance.

This facility is a bulk storage and retail propane facility.  There is a 12,000 gallon aboveground storage tank for anhydrous ammonia.

Worst Case Scenario (Toxics):  Tank failure of the 12,000 gallon anhydrous ammonia tank, resulting in the liquid spill and vaporization of approximately 61,651 lbs of anhydrous ammonia.  According to the EPA's look-up tables, the distance to the endpoint is calculated as 3.80 miles.  Depending on wind direction, this endpoint may include most of the city of Waynesboro.  Waynesboro has an estimated total population of 5,825.

There has never been an accident at this facility involving anhydrous ammonia that resulted in deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.  There are no planned changes to the safety procedures for this facility at this time.
